ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Requests all statistics and tables that the FREQ, MODES, NEXTRVAL=5, PLOT, and CIBASIC 
options generate.

[Syntax: ALPHA=α] 
      
Specifies the level of significance a for 100(1 - α)% confidence intervals.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CIBASIC <(<TYPE=keyword> <ALPHA=>)>] 
      
Requests confidence limits for the mean, standard deviation, and variance based on the 
assumption that the data are normally distributed.

[Syntax: CIPCTLDF <(<TYPE=keyword> <ALPHA=>)>] 
      
Requests confidence limits for quantiles based on a method that is distribution-free.

[Syntax: CIPCTLNORMAL <(<TYPE=keyword> <ALPHA=>)>] 
      
Requests confidence limits for quantiles based on the assumption that the data are 
normally distributed.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the input SAS data set to be analyzed.

Excludes observations with nonpositive weight values (zero or negative) from the analysis. 
By default, PROC UNIVARIATE counts observations with negative or zero weights in the total 
number of observations. This option applies only when you use a WEIGHT statement.

Requests a frequency table that consists of the variable values, frequencies, cell percentages, 
and cumulative percentages.

[Syntax: GOUT=graphics-catalog] 
      
Specifies the SAS catalog that PROC UNIVARIATE uses to save traditional graphics output.
Includes ID variables in the output data set created by an OUTPUT statement.

Requests a table that shows the number of observations greater than, not equal to, and less 
than the value of MU0=. PROC UNIVARIATE uses these values to construct the sign test and 
the signed rank test. This option does not apply if you use a WEIGHT statement.
Requests a table of all possible modes.

[Syntax:MU0=values] 
      
Specifies the value of the mean or location parameter (muo) in the null hypothesis for 
tests of location summarized in the table labeled "Tests for Location: Mu0=value."

[Syntax: NEXTROBS=n] 
      
Specifies the number of extreme observations that PROC UNIVARIATE lists in the table of 
extreme observations.

[Syntax: NEXTRVAL=n] 
      
Specifies the number of extreme values that PROC UNIVARIATE lists in the table 
of extreme values.

Suppresses side-by-side line printer box plots that are created by default when you use the 
BY statement and either the ALL option or the PLOT option in the PROC statement.

Suppresses all the tables of descriptive statistics that the PROC UNIVARIATE statement creates. 
NOPRINT does not suppress the tables that the HISTOGRAM statement creates.

Requests tests for normality that include a series of goodness-of-fit tests based on the 
empirical distribution function.

Suppresses the table of contents entries for tables of summary statistics produced by the 
PROC UNIVARIATE statement.

Suppresses grouping entries associated with analysis variables in the table of contents. 
By default, the table of contents lists results associated with an analysis variable in a 
group with the variable name.

[Syntax: OUTTABLE=SAS-data-set] 
      
Creates an output data set that contains univariate statistics arranged in tabular form, with 
one observation per analysis variable.
Specifies the definition that PROC UNIVARIATE uses to calculate quantiles.

Produces a stem-and-leaf plot (or a horizontal bar chart), a box plot, and a normal quantile 
plot in line printer output.

[Syntax: PLOTSIZE=n] 
      
Specifies the approximate number of rows used in line-printer plots requested with the PLOTS option.
Produces a table with robust estimates of scale.

[Syntax: ROUND=units] 
      
Specifies the units to use to round the analysis variables prior to computing statistics.

[Syntax: SUMMARYCONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents entry used for grouping the summary statistics produced 
by the PROC UNIVARIATE statement.

Syntax: TRIMMED=values <(<TYPE=keyword> <ALPHA=>)>
      
Requests a table of trimmed means, where value specifies the number or the proportion of 
observations that PROC UNIVARIATE trims.
Specifies the divisor to use in the calculation of variances and standard deviation.

Syntax: WINSORIZED=values <(<TYPE=keyword> <ALPHA=>)>
      
Requests of a table of Winsorized means, where value is the number or the proportion 
of observations that PROC UNIVARIATE uses to compute the Winsorized mean.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
Obtains separate analyses for each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately 
follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ID variable(s);
      
Specifies one or more variables to include in the table of extreme observations. 
The corresponding values of the ID variables appear beside the n largest and n 
smallest observations, where n is the value of NEXTROBS= option.  

You can also include ID variables in the output data set created by an OUTPUT 
statement by specifying the IDOUT option in the PROC UNIVARIATE statement.

Syntax: VAR variable(s); 
      
Specifies the analysis variables and their order in the results. By default, if you omit 
the VAR statement, PROC UNIVARIATE analyzes all numeric variables that are not listed in 
the other statements.

Syntax: FREQ variable; 
      
The FREQ statement specifies a numeric variable whose value represents the frequency 
of the observation. If you use the FREQ statement, the procedure assumes that each 
observation represents n observations, where n is the value of variable. If the variable 
is not an integer, the SAS System truncates it. If the variable is less than 1 or is 
missing, the procedure excludes that observation from the analysis.  

Note: The FREQ statement affects the degrees of freedom, but the WEIGHT statement does not.

Syntax: WEIGHT variable; 
      
Specifies numeric weights for analysis variables in the statistical calculations. The 
UNIVARIATE procedure uses the values of the WEIGHT variable to modify the computation 
of a number of summary statistics by assuming that the variance of the ith value xi of 
the analysis variable is equal to σ²/wi, where σ is an unknown parameter. The values of 
the WEIGHT variable do not have to be integers and are typically positive. By default, 
observations with nonpositive or missing values of the WEIGHT variable are handled as 
follows:1 

  o If the value is zero, the observation is counted in the total number of observations. 

  o If the value is negative, it is converted to zero, and the observation is counted in 
    the total number of observations. 

  o If the value is missing, the observation is excluded from the analysis.

Syntax: CDFPLOT <variables> < / options> ;
      
Plots the observed cumulative distribution function (cdf) of a variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the 
Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions 
requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose 
the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a 
comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for 
Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option 
in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in  
between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of 
iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of
a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 
option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color | COLOR=color-list] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or 
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color 
specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a 
Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses 
after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, 
and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. 
Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The 
INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line 
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. 
By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, 
LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option 
and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose 
the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The 
default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master 
menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available 
unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, 
and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use 
the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also 
suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless 
you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use 
the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto 
a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= 
option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions 
requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This 
happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you 
can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor 
tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= 
and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the 
number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option 
or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses 
for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter α for distribution functions requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA<(beta-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted beta distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of beta-options:

  ALPHA=value -- specifies first shape parameter, α, for beta distribution function 
  BETA=value -- specifies second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution function 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for beta distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies lower threshold parameter, θ, for beta distribution function 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function
  W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: BETA=value] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution functions requested by the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Weibull distribution functions requested with the WEIBULL option.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted exponential distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of exponential-options:

  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for exponential distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ,  for exponential distribution function 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
  W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: GAMMA<(gamma-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted gamma distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of gamma-options:

  ALPHADELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of α at which the Newton-Raphson approximation 
    of α-hat terminates 
  ALPHAINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for α in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
  MAXITER= -- specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for gamma distribution function 
  ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α, for gamma distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ,  for gamma distribution function
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
  W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL<(lognormal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted lognormal distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of lognormal-options:

  ZETA=value -- specifies scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal distribution function 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies shape parameter, σ, for lognormal distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for lognormal distribution function
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
  W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, μ, for normal distribution functions requested with the NORMAL option.

Suppresses the observed distribution function (the empirical cumulative distribution function) of 
the variable, which is drawn by default.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted normal distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of normal-options:

  MU=value -- specifies mean µ for normal distribution function 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies standard deviation, σ, for normal distribution function
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
  W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for distribution functions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, 
LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for theoretical cumulative distribution functions 
requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for theoretical cumulative distribution functions 
requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.
Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WEIBULL<(Weibull-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted Weibull distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of Weibull-options:

  C=value -- specifies shape parameter c for Weibull distribution function 
  CDELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of c at which the Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat terminates 
  CINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for c in the Newton-Raphson approximation of  
  MAXITER=value -- specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for Weibull distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for Weibull distribution function 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
  W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: ZETA=value] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for a lognormal distribution function 
requested with the LOGNORMAL option.
Specifies that missing values for the CLASS variable are to be treated as valid classification levels.
Specifies the display order for the CLASS variable values.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order  depends on your operating environment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: KEYLEVEL=value | ( value1 value2 )] 
          
Specifies the key cells in comparative plots.

Specifies that the location of the key cell in a comparative plot be unchanged by the CLASS 
statement KEYLEVEL= option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma 
distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose 
the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for 
Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option 
in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in  
between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of 
iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 
option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color | COLOR=color-list] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the 
KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for 
multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
          
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master 
menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a 
Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses 
after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for 
axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified 
in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, 
and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. 
Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= 
option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. 
By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option 
and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose 
the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The 
default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only 
one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify
two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses 
the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available 
unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, 
you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto 
a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, 
for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for 
the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens 
by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. 
Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also 
see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must
equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option 
or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses 
for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter α for distribution functions requested with the BETA 
and GAMMA options.
Displays labels above the histogram bars.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The label shows the number of observations associated with a given bar.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The label shows the percentage of observations represented by that bar.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The label displays the proportion of observations associated with the bar.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BARWIDTH=value] 
          
Specifies the width of the histogram bars in percentage screen units.)>

[Syntax: BETA<(beta-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted beta distribution function on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following beta-options:

ALPHA=value.....specifies first shape parameter, α, for beta distribution function 
BETA=value.......specifies second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution function 
SIGMA=value.....specifies scale parameter, σ, for beta distribution function 
THETA=value.....specifies lower threshold parameter, θ, for beta distribution function 
COLOR=............specifies colors of density curves 
CONTENTS=.......specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
FILL..................fills area under density curve 
L=.....................specifies line types of density curves 
MIDPERCENTS...prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
NOPRINT...........suppresses tables summarizing curves 
PERCENTS=.......lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
W=...................specifies widths of density curves

[Syntax: BETA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for beta density curves requested by the 
BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value-list] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Weibull distribution functions requested with the 
WEIBULL option.

[Syntax: CBARLINE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the outline of the histogram bars when producing traditional graphics.

[Syntax: CFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the bars of the histogram (or the area under a fitted density 
curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional graphics.

[Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for grid lines when a grid displays on the histogram in 
traditional graphics.
Draws reference lines requested with the HREF= and VREF= options behind the histogram bars.

[Syntax: DELTA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the first shape parameter, d, for Johnson sB and Johnson sU distribution functions 
requested with the SB and SU options.

[Syntax: ENDPOINTS <=values | KEY | UNIFORM>] 
          
Uses histogram bin endpoints as the tick mark values for the horizontal axis and 
determines how to compute the bin width of the histogram bars.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted exponential distribution function on the histogram. 
          
You can specify the following exponential-options:

SIGMA=value         specifies scale parameter, σ, for exponential curve 
THETA=value         specifies threshold parameter, θ, for exponential curve
COLOR=              specifies colors of density curves 
CONTENTS=           specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
FILL                fills area under density curve 
L=                  specifies line types of density curves 
MIDPERCENTS         prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
NOPRINT             suppresses tables summarizing curves 
PERCENTS=           lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
W=                  specifies widths of density curves
Fills areas under the fitted density curve or the kernel density estimate with colors and patterns.
Forces the creation of a histogram if there is only one unique observation.
Draws reference lines requested with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of the histogram bars.

[Syntax: GAMMA<(gamma-options)>] 
          
Displays fitted gamma density curves on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following gamma-options:

  ALPHADELTA=value--specifies change in successive estimates of α at which the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat terminates 
  ALPHAINITIAL=value--specifies initial value for α in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
  MAXITER=--specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
  SIGMA=value--specifies scale parameter, σ, for gamma curve 
  ALPHA=value--specifies shape parameter, α,  for gamma curve 
  THETA=value--specifies threshold parameter, θ, for gamma curve
  COLOR=--specifies colors of density curves 
  CONTENTS=--specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
  FILL--ills area under density curve 
  L=--specifies line types of density curves 
  MIDPERCENTS--prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
  NOPRINT--suppresses tables summarizing curves 
  PERCENTS=--lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
  W=--specifies widths of density curves

[Syntax: GAMMA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, γ, for Johnson SB and Johnson SU distribution functions 
requested with the SB and SU options.
Displays a grid on the histogram.
Requests a hanging histogram,

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at both ends of the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: INTERBAR=value] 
          
Specifies the space between histogram bars in percentage screen units.

Specifies the kernel function (normal, quadratic, or triangular) used to compute a kernel 
density estimate.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Quadratic kernel function

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: KERNEL<(kernel-options)>] 
          
Superimposes kernel density estimates on the histogram.
          
You can specify the kernel-options described below: 

  C=--specifies standardized bandwidth parameter  
  COLOR=--specifies color of the kernel density curve 
  FILL--fills area under kernel density curve 
  K=--specifies type of kernel function 
  L=--specifies line type used for kernel density curve 
  LOWER=--specifies lower bound for kernel density curve 
  UPPER=--specifies upper bound for kernel density curve 
  W=--specifies line width for kernel density curve

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the grid when a grid displays on the histogram.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL<(lognormal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted lognormal distribution function on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following lognormal-options:

  SIGMA=value--specifies scale parameter, σ, for exponential curve 
  THETA=value--specifies threshold parameter, θ, for exponential curve
  ZETA=--specifies scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal curve
  COLOR=--specifies colors of density curves 
  CONTENTS=--specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
  FILL--fills area under density curve 
  L=--specifies line types of density curves 
  MIDPERCENTS--prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
  NOPRINT--suppresses tables summarizing curves 
  PERCENTS=--lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
  W=--specifies widths of density curves

[Syntax: LOWER=value-list] 
          
Specifies lower bounds for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

[Syntax: MAXNBIN=n] 
          
Limits the number of bins displayed in the comparative histogram.

[Syntax: MAXSIGMAS=value] 
          
Limits the number of bins displayed in the comparative histogram to a range of value 
standard deviations (of the data in the key cell) above and below the mean of the data 
in the key cell.
Requests a table listing the midpoints and percentage of observations in each histogram interval.

[Syntax: MIDPOINTS=values | KEY | UNIFORM] 
          
Specifies how to determine the midpoints for the histogram intervals, where values determines 
the width of the histogram bars as the difference between consecutive midpoints.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference  between consecutive midpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The procedure first determines the midpoints for the data in the key cell. The initial number  of midpoints is based on the number of observations in the key cell by using the method of  Terrell and Scott (1985). The midpoint list for the key cell is then extended in either  direction as necessary until it spans the data in the remaining cells.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The procedure determines the midpoints using all the observations as if there were no cells.  In other words, the number of midpoints is computed from the total sample size by using the  method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal density curves requested with the NORMAL option.

[Syntax: NENDPOINTS=n] 
          
Uses histogram interval endpoints as the tick mark values for the horizontal axis 
and determines the number of bins.

[Syntax: NMIDPOINTS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of histogram intervals.
Suppresses drawing of histogram bars, which is useful for viewing fitted curves only.

Suppresses the creation of a plot. Use this option when you only want to tabulate summary 
statistics for a fitted density or create an OUTHISTOGRAM= data set.

Suppresses the creation of a plot. Use this option when you only want to tabulate summary 
statistics for a fitted density or create an OUTHISTOGRAM= data set.

Suppresses tables summarizing the fitted curve. Enclose the NOPRINT option in parentheses 
following the distribution option.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted normal density curves on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following normal-options:

  MU=--specifies mean μ for normal curve 
  SIGMA=--specifies standard deviation σ for normal curve 
  COLOR=--specifies colors of density curves 
  CONTENTS=--specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
  FILL--fills area under density curve 
  L=--specifies line types of density curves 
  MIDPERCENTS--prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
  NOPRINT--suppresses tables summarizing curves 
  PERCENTS=--lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
  W=--specifies widths of density curves
Suppresses the table of contents entries for tables produced by the HISTOGRAM statement.

[Syntax: OUTHISTOGRAM=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates a SAS data set that contains information about histogram intervals.

[Syntax: PERCENTS=values] 
          
Specifies a list of percents for which quantiles calculated from the data and quantiles 
estimated from the fitted curve are tabulated.

[Syntax: PFILL=pattern] 
          
Specifies a pattern used to fill the bars of the histograms (or the areas under a fitted 
curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional graphics.
Includes the right endpoint of each histogram interval in that interval.

[Syntax: SB<(sB-options)>] 
          
Displays fitted Johnson sB density curves on the histogram.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for distribution functions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: SU<(sU-options)>] 
          
Displays fitted Johnson sU density curves on the histogram.

[Syntax: THETA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for curves requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, SB, SU, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: UPPER=value-list] 
          
Specifies upper bounds for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

[Syntax: VOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at the upper end of the vertical axis.

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for theoretical cumulative distribution functions 
requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.
Specifies the scale of the vertical axis for a histogram.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WBARLINE=n] 
          
Specifies the width of bar outlines when producing traditional graphics.

[Syntax: WEIBULL<(Weibull-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted Weibull density curves on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following Weibull-options:

  C=value--specifies shape parameter c for Weibull distribution function 
  CDELTA=value--specifies change in successive estimates of c at which the Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat terminates 
  CINITIAL=value--specifies initial value for c in the Newton-Raphson approximation of  
  MAXITER=value--specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat 
  SIGMA=value--specifies scale parameter, σ, for Weibull distribution function 
  THETA=value--specifies threshold parameter, θ, for Weibull distribution function 
  COLOR=--specifies colors of density curves 
  CONTENTS=--specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
  FILL--fills area under density curve 
  L=--specifies line types of density curves 
  MIDPERCENTS--prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
  NOPRINT--suppresses tables summarizing curves 
  PERCENTS=--lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
  W=--specifies widths of density curves

[Syntax: WGRID=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness for the grid when producing traditional graphics.

[Syntax: ZETA=value-list] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal density curves requested with 
the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
          
Requests that PROC UNIVARIATE display customized statistics from a SAS data set in the 
inset table.

[Syntax: CFILL=color | BLANK] 
          
Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not 
specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents 
items from showing through the inset.
Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

[Syntax: CFILLH=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header background for traditional graphics. The default value 
is the CFILL= color.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the frame for traditional graphics. The default value is the same 
color as the axis of the plot.

[Syntax: CHEADER=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header text for traditional graphics. The default value 
is the CTEXT= color.

[Syntax: CSHADOW=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the drop shadow for traditional graphics. By default, 
if a CSHADOW= option is not specified, a drop shadow is not displayed.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the text for traditional graphics. The default value 
is the same color as the other text on the plot.

Specifies that data coordinates are to be used in positioning the inset with the 
POSITION= option.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies the font of the text for traditional graphics. By default, if you locate 
the inset in the interior of the plot, then the font is SIMPLEX. If you locate the 
inset in the exterior of the plot, then the font is the same as the other text on 
the plot.

[Syntax: FORMAT=format] 
          
Specifies a format for all the values in the inset.

[Syntax: HEADER='string'] 
          
Specifies the header text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters. By default, 
no header line appears in the inset.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of the text for traditional graphics.

[Syntax: POSITION=position] 
          
Determines the position of the inset.  The position is a compass point keyword, a margin 
keyword, or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in axis percent units 
or axis data units. The default value is NW, which positions the inset in the upper left 
(northwest) corner of the display.

Specifies the reference point for an inset that PROC UNIVARIATE positions by a pair of 
coordinates with the POSITION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Bottom left (the default)

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OUTPUT <OUT=SAS-data-set < keyword1=names ...keywordk=names > < percentile-options >> ;
      
The OUTPUT statement saves statistics and BY variables in an output data set. When you use 
a BY statement, each observation in the OUT= data set corresponds to one of the BY groups. 
Otherwise, the OUT= data set contains only one observation. 

You can use any number of OUTPUT statements in the UNIVARIATE procedure. Each OUTPUT statement 
creates a new data set containing the statistics specified in that statement. You must use the 
VAR statement with the OUTPUT statement. The OUTPUT statement must contain a specification of 
the form keyword=names or the PCTLPTS= and PCTLPRE= specifications.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Identifies the output data set.

[Syntax: PCTLPTS=percentiles] 
          
Specifies one or more percentiles that are not automatically computed by the 
UNIVARIATE procedure.

[Syntax: PCTLPRE=prefixes] 
          
Specifies one or more prefixes to create the variable names for the variables that 
contain the PCTLPTS= percentiles.

[Syntax: PCTLNAME=suffixes] 
          
Specifies one or more suffixes to create the names for the variables that contain the 
PCTLPTS= percentiles.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PPPLOT <variables> < / options> ;
      
The PPPLOT statement creates a probability-probability plot (also referred to as a P-P plot 
or percent plot), which compares the empirical cumulative distribution function (ecdf) of a 
variable with a specified theoretical cumulative distribution function such as the normal.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the 
Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions 
requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose 
the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for 
Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option 
in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in  
between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of 
iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not 
filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left 
side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 
option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color | COLOR=color-list] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the 
KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
          
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu 
for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to 
fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is 
used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts 
for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font 
specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, 
and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. 
Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= 
option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. 
By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option 
and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose 
the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The 
default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available 
unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, 
and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use 
the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also 
suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available 
unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, 
you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto 
a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the 
SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for 
distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens 
by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. 
Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also 
see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option 
or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses 
for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter α for P-P plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA<(beta-options)>] 
          
Creates a beta P-P plot.

[Syntax: BETA=value] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for P-P plots requested by the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c, for P-P plots requested with the WEIBULL option

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options )>] 
          
Creates an exponential P-P plot.

[Syntax: GAMMA<(gamma-options)>] 
          
Creates a gamma P-P plot.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL<(lognormal-options)>] 
          
Creates a lognormal P-P plot.

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ,  for normal P-P plot requested with the NORMAL option.
Suppresses the diagonal reference line.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Creates a normal P-P plot.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the scale parameter, σ, for P-P plots requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, 
LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for theoretical cumulative distribution 
functions requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for P-P plots requested with the BETA, 
EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.
Displays the P-P plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

[Syntax: WEIBULL<(Weibull-options)>] 
          
Creates a Weibull P-P plot.

[Syntax: ZETA=value] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ,  for a lognormal P-P plots requested 
with the LOGNORMAL option.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROBPLOT <variables> < / options> ; 
      
The PROBPLOT statement creates a probability plot, which compares ordered variable values 
with the percentiles of a specified theoretical distribution. If the data distribution 
matches the theoretical distribution, the points on the plot form a linear pattern.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma 
distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose 
the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for 
Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option 
in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in  
between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of 
iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 
option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color | COLOR=color-list] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the 
KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for 
multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
          
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the
proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master 
menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to 
fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts 
for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font 
specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, 
and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. 
Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

[Syntax: WAXIS=n]

[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list | EST] 
          
Specifies the mandatory shape parameter α for probability plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA(ALPHA=value | EST  BETA=value | EST <beta-options>)] 
          
Creates a beta probability plot for each combination of the required shape parameters, 
a and β, specified by the required ALPHA= and BETA= beta-options.)>

[Syntax: BETA=value|EST] 
          
Specifies the mandatory shape parameter, β, for probability plots requested with the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value-list|EST] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c,  for probability plots requested with the WEIBULL 
and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for grid lines when a grid displays on the plot. This option also 
produces a grid.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options )>] 
          
Creates an exponential probability plot.

[Syntax: GAMMA(ALPHA=value | EST <gamma-options>)] 
          
Creates a gamma probability plot for each value of the shape parameter α given 
by the mandatory ALPHA= gamma-option.

Displays a grid. Grid lines are reference lines that are perpendicular to the percentile axis 
at major tick marks.

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the grid requested by the GRID= option. By default, LGRID=1, 
which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL(SIGMA=value | EST <lognormal-options>)] 
          
Creates a lognormal probability plot for each value of the shape parameter, σ, given 
by the mandatory SIGMA= lognormal-option.

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal probability plot requested with the NORMAL option.

Specifies the adjustment value added to the sample size in the calculation of theoretical 
percentiles. By default, NADJ=1/4.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Creates a normal probabilty plot.
Requests minor tick marks for the percentile axis.

[Syntax: PCTLORDER=values] 
          
Specifies the tick marks that are labeled on the theoretical percentile axis.

[Syntax: RANKADJ=value] 
          
Specifies the adjustment value added to the ranks in the calculation of theoretical 
percentiles.

Switches the horizontal and vertical axes so that the theoretical percentiles are plotted 
vertically while the data are plotted horizontally.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for probability plots requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, 
LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: SLOPE=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the slope for a distribution reference line requested with the LOGNORMAL 
and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST]

GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=value | EST]

GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.
Displays the probability plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

[Syntax: WEIBULL(C=value | EST <Weibull-options>)] 
          
Creates a three-parameter Weibull probability plot for each value of the required 
shape parameter, c, specified by the mandatory C= Weibull-option.

[Syntax: WEIBULL2<(Weibull2-options)>]
