By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, 
the height specified with the HTEXT=
option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, 
of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available 
unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL 
option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple 
density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, 
LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull 
distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses 
after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master 
menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless 
you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 
if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option 
with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also 
suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless 
you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use 
the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto 
a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, 
WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= 
option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions 
requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by 
default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you 
can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor 
tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= 
and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the 
number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. 
In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list | EST] 
          
 Specifies the mandatory shape parameter α for quantile plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA(ALPHA=value | EST  BETA=value | EST <beta-options>)] 
          
Creates a beta quantile plot for each combination of the required shape parameters, 
α and β, specified by the required ALPHA= and BETA= beta-options.)>

[Syntax: BETA=value|EST] 
          
Specifies the mandatory shape parameter, β, for quantile plots requested with the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value-list|EST] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c,  for quantile plots requested with the WEIBULL 
and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for grid lines when a grid displays on the plot. This option 
also produces a grid.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options )>] 
          
Creates an exponential quantile plot.

[Syntax: GAMMA(ALPHA=value | EST <gamma-options>)] 
          
Creates a gamma quantile plot for each value of the shape parameter α given by the 
mandatory ALPHA= gamma-option.
Displays a grid of horizontal lines positioned at major tick marks on the vertical axis.

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the grid requested by the GRID= option. By default, 
LGRID=1, which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL(SIGMA=value | EST <lognormal-options>)] 
          
Creates a lognormal quantile plot for each value of the shape parameter σ given by the 
mandatory SIGMA= lognormal-option.

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal quantile plot requested with the NORMAL option.

Specifies the adjustment value added to the sample size in the calculation of theoretical 
percentiles. By default, NADJ=1/4.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Creates a normal qunatile plot.

[Syntax: PCTLAXIS<(axis-options)>] 
          
Adds a nonlinear percentile axis along the frame of the Q-Q plot opposite the theoretical quantile axis

Requests scale labels for the theoretical quantile axis in percentile units, resulting in 
a nonlinear axis scale.

[Syntax: RANKADJ=value] 
          
Specifies the adjustment value added to the ranks in the calculation of theoretical percentiles.

Switches the horizontal and vertical axes so that the theoretical quantiles are plotted 
vertically while the data are plotted horizontally.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for quantile plots requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, 
LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options

[Syntax: SLOPE=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the slope for a distribution reference line requested with the LOGNORMAL 
and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for plots requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for plots requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.
Displays the quantile plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

[Syntax: WEIBULL(C=value | EST <Weibull-options>)] 
          
Creates a three-parameter Weibull quantile plot for each value of the required 
shape parameter, c, specified by the mandatory C= Weibull-option.

[Syntax: WEIBULL2<(Weibull2-options)>] 
          
Creates a two-parameter Weibull quantile plot.

[Syntax: WGRID=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness for the grid when producing traditional graphics. The option 
does not apply to ODS Graphics output.

[Syntax: ZETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for the lognormal quantile plots requested 
with the LOGNORMAL option.
